		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember()]
		public System.Nullable<System.Double> PassingTouchdowns { get; set; }
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember()]
		public System.Nullable<System.Double> PassingYards { get; set; }
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember()]
		public System.Nullable<System.Double> PassingYardsPerAttempt { get; set; }
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember()]
		public System.Nullable<System.Double> PassingYardsPerCompletion { get; set; }
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember()]
		public System.Nullable<System.Int32> Penalties { get; set; }
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember()]
		public System.Nullable<System.Int32> PenaltyYards { get; set; }
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember()]
		public System.Nullable<System.Double> PuntAverage { get; set; }
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember()]
		public System.Nullable<System.Double> PuntLong { get; set; }
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember()]
		public System.Nullable<System.Double> PuntReturnLong { get; set; }
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember()]
		public System.Nullable<System.Double> PuntReturnTouchdowns { get; set; }
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember()]
		public System.Nullable<System.Double> PuntReturnYards { get; set; }
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember()]
		public System.Nullable<System.Double> PuntReturnYardsPerAttempt { get; set; }
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember()]
		public System.Nullable<System.Double> PuntReturns { get; set; }
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember()]
		public System.Nullable<System.Double> PuntYards { get; set; }
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember()]
		public System.Nullable<System.Double> Punts { get; set; }
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember()]
		public System.Nullable<System.Double> QuarterbackHurries { get; set; }
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember()]
		public System.Nullable<System.Double> ReceivingLong { get; set; }
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember()]
		public System.Nullable<System.Double> ReceivingTouchdowns { get; set; }
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember()]
		public System.Nullable<System.Double> ReceivingYards { get; set; }
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember()]
		public System.Nullable<System.Double> ReceivingYardsPerReception { get; set; }
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember()]
		public System.Nullable<System.Double> Receptions { get; set; }
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember()]
		public System.Nullable<System.Double> RushingAttempts { get; set; }
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember()]
		public System.Nullable<System.Double> RushingLong { get; set; }
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember()]
		public System.Nullable<System.Double> RushingTouchdowns { get; set; }
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember()]
		public System.Nullable<System.Double> RushingYards { get; set; }
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember()]
		public System.Nullable<System.Double> RushingYardsPerAttempt { get; set; }
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember()]
		public System.Nullable<System.Double> Sacks { get; set; }
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember()]
		public System.Nullable<System.Int32> Score { get; set; }
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember()]
		public System.Nullable<System.Int32> Season { get; set; }
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember()]
		public System.Nullable<System.Int32> SeasonType { get; set; }
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember()]
		public System.Nullable<System.Double> SoloTackles { get; set; }
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember()]
		public System.Nullable<System.Int32> StatID { get; set; }
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember()]
		public System.Nullable<System.Double> TacklesForLoss { get; set; }
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember()]
		public string Team { get; set; }
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember()]
		public System.Nullable<System.Int32> TeamID { get; set; }
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember()]
		public System.Nullable<System.Int32> ThirdDownAttempts { get; set; }
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember()]
		public System.Nullable<System.Int32> ThirdDownConversions { get; set; }
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember()]
		public System.Nullable<System.Int32> TimeOfPossessionMinutes { get; set; }
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember()]
		public System.Nullable<System.Int32> TimeOfPossessionSeconds { get; set; }
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember()]
		public string Updated { get; set; }
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember()]
		public System.Nullable<System.Int32> Week { get; set; }
	}
	
	[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataContract(Namespace="")]
	[System.SerializableAttribute()]
	public class TeamSeason
	{
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember()]
		public System.Nullable<System.Double> AssistedTackles { get; set; }
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember()]
		public System.Nullable<System.Int32> ConferenceLosses { get; set; }

	public partial class Misc
	{
		
		private System.Net.Http.HttpClient httpClient;
		
		private JsonSerializerSettings jsonSerializerSettings;
		
		public Misc(System.Net.Http.HttpClient httpClient, JsonSerializerSettings jsonSerializerSettings=null)
		{
			if (httpClient == null)
				throw new ArgumentNullException("Null HttpClient.", "httpClient");

			if (httpClient.BaseAddress == null)
				throw new ArgumentNullException("HttpClient has no BaseAddress", "httpClient");

			this.httpClient = httpClient;
			this.jsonSerializerSettings = jsonSerializerSettings;
		}
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Are Games In Progress
		/// Returns <code>true</code> if there is at least one game being played at the time of the request or <code>false</code> if there are none.
		/// AreGamesInProgress {format}/AreAnyGamesInProgress
		/// </summary>
		/// <param name="format">Desired response format. Valid entries are <code>xml</code> or <code>json</code>.</param>
		public async Task<bool> AreGamesInProgressAsync(AreGamesInProgressFormat format, Action<System.Net.Http.Headers.HttpRequestHeaders> handleHeaders = null)
		{
			var requestUri = ""+format+"/AreAnyGamesInProgress";
			using (var httpRequestMessage = new System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage(System.Net.Http.HttpMethod.Get, requestUri))
			{
			if (handleHeaders != null)
			{
				handleHeaders(httpRequestMessage.Headers);
			}

			var responseMessage = await httpClient.SendAsync(httpRequestMessage);
			try
			{
				responseMessage.EnsureSuccessStatusCodeEx();
				var responseMessageStream = await responseMessage.Content.ReadAsStreamAsync();
				using (JsonReader jsonReader = new JsonTextReader(new System.IO.StreamReader(responseMessageStream)))
				{
				var serializer = JsonSerializer.Create(jsonSerializerSettings);
				return serializer.Deserialize<bool>(jsonReader);
				}
			}
			finally
			{
				responseMessage.Dispose();
			}
			}
		}
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Current Season
		/// CurrentSeason {format}/CurrentSeason
		/// </summary>
		/// <param name="format">Desired response format. Valid entries are <code>xml</code> or <code>json</code>.</param>
		public async Task<int> CurrentSeasonAsync(AreGamesInProgressFormat format, Action<System.Net.Http.Headers.HttpRequestHeaders> handleHeaders = null)
		{
			var requestUri = ""+format+"/CurrentSeason";
			using (var httpRequestMessage = new System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage(System.Net.Http.HttpMethod.Get, requestUri))
			{
			if (handleHeaders != null)
			{
				handleHeaders(httpRequestMessage.Headers);
			}

			var responseMessage = await httpClient.SendAsync(httpRequestMessage);
			try
			{
				responseMessage.EnsureSuccessStatusCodeEx();
				var responseMessageStream = await responseMessage.Content.ReadAsStreamAsync();
				using (JsonReader jsonReader = new JsonTextReader(new System.IO.StreamReader(responseMessageStream)))
				{
				var serializer = JsonSerializer.Create(jsonSerializerSettings);
				return serializer.Deserialize<int>(jsonReader);
				}
			}
			finally
			{
				responseMessage.Dispose();
			}
			}
		}
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Current Season Details
		/// CurrentSeasonDetails {format}/CurrentSeasonDetails
		/// </summary>
		/// <param name="format">Desired response format. Valid entries are <code>xml</code> or <code>json</code>.</param>
		public async Task<Season> CurrentSeasonDetailsAsync(AreGamesInProgressFormat format, Action<System.Net.Http.Headers.HttpRequestHeaders> handleHeaders = null)
		{
			var requestUri = ""+format+"/CurrentSeasonDetails";
			using (var httpRequestMessage = new System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage(System.Net.Http.HttpMethod.Get, requestUri))
			{
			if (handleHeaders != null)
			{
				handleHeaders(httpRequestMessage.Headers);
			}

			var responseMessage = await httpClient.SendAsync(httpRequestMessage);
			try
			{
				responseMessage.EnsureSuccessStatusCodeEx();
				var responseMessageStream = await responseMessage.Content.ReadAsStreamAsync();
				using (JsonReader jsonReader = new JsonTextReader(new System.IO.StreamReader(responseMessageStream)))
				{
				var serializer = JsonSerializer.Create(jsonSerializerSettings);
				return serializer.Deserialize<Season>(jsonReader);
				}
			}
			finally
			{
				responseMessage.Dispose();
			}
			}
		}
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Current SeasonType
		/// CurrentSeasontype {format}/CurrentSeasonType
		/// </summary>
		/// <param name="format">Desired response format. Valid entries are <code>xml</code> or <code>json</code>.</param>
		public async Task<string> CurrentSeasontypeAsync(AreGamesInProgressFormat format, Action<System.Net.Http.Headers.HttpRequestHeaders> handleHeaders = null)
		{
			var requestUri = ""+format+"/CurrentSeasonType";
			using (var httpRequestMessage = new System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage(System.Net.Http.HttpMethod.Get, requestUri))
			{
			if (handleHeaders != null)
			{
				handleHeaders(httpRequestMessage.Headers);
			}

			var responseMessage = await httpClient.SendAsync(httpRequestMessage);
			try
			{
				responseMessage.EnsureSuccessStatusCodeEx();
				var responseMessageStream = await responseMessage.Content.ReadAsStreamAsync();
				using (JsonReader jsonReader = new JsonTextReader(new System.IO.StreamReader(responseMessageStream)))
				{
				return jsonReader.ReadAsString();
				}
			}
			finally
			{
				responseMessage.Dispose();
			}
			}
		}
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Current Week
		/// CurrentWeek {format}/CurrentWeek
		/// </summary>
		/// <param name="format">Desired response format. Valid entries are <code>xml</code> or <code>json</code>.</param>
		public async Task<int> CurrentWeekAsync(AreGamesInProgressFormat format, Action<System.Net.Http.Headers.HttpRequestHeaders> handleHeaders = null)
		{
			var requestUri = ""+format+"/CurrentWeek";
			using (var httpRequestMessage = new System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage(System.Net.Http.HttpMethod.Get, requestUri))
			{
			if (handleHeaders != null)
			{
				handleHeaders(httpRequestMessage.Headers);
			}

			var responseMessage = await httpClient.SendAsync(httpRequestMessage);
			try
			{
				responseMessage.EnsureSuccessStatusCodeEx();
				var responseMessageStream = await responseMessage.Content.ReadAsStreamAsync();
				using (JsonReader jsonReader = new JsonTextReader(new System.IO.StreamReader(responseMessageStream)))
				{
				var serializer = JsonSerializer.Create(jsonSerializerSettings);
				return serializer.Deserialize<int>(jsonReader);
				}
			}
			finally
			{
				responseMessage.Dispose();
			}
			}
		}
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Schedules
		/// Schedules {format}/Games/{season}
		/// </summary>
		/// <param name="format">Desired response format. Valid entries are <code>xml</code> or <code>json</code>.</param>
		/// <param name="season">Year of the season (with optional season type).<br>Examples: <code>2018</code>, <code>2018PRE</code>, <code>2018POST</code>, <code>2018STAR</code>, <code>2019</code>, etc.</param>
		public async Task<Game[]> SchedulesAsync(AreGamesInProgressFormat format, string season, Action<System.Net.Http.Headers.HttpRequestHeaders> handleHeaders = null)
		{
			var requestUri = ""+format+"/Games/"+ (season==null? "" : System.Uri.EscapeDataString(season));
			using (var httpRequestMessage = new System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage(System.Net.Http.HttpMethod.Get, requestUri))
			{
			if (handleHeaders != null)
			{
				handleHeaders(httpRequestMessage.Headers);
			}

			var responseMessage = await httpClient.SendAsync(httpRequestMessage);
			try
			{
				responseMessage.EnsureSuccessStatusCodeEx();
				var responseMessageStream = await responseMessage.Content.ReadAsStreamAsync();
				using (JsonReader jsonReader = new JsonTextReader(new System.IO.StreamReader(responseMessageStream)))
				{
				var serializer = JsonSerializer.Create(jsonSerializerSettings);
				return serializer.Deserialize<Game[]>(jsonReader);
				}
			}
			finally
			{
				responseMessage.Dispose();
			}
			}
		}
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Games by Date
		/// GamesByDate {format}/GamesByDate/{date}
		/// </summary>
		/// <param name="format">Desired response format. Valid entries are <code>xml</code> or <code>json</code>.</param>
		/// <param name="date">
		///          The date of the game(s).
		///          <br>Examples: <code>2016-SEP-01</code>, <code>2017-SEP-10</code>.
		///        </param>
		public async Task<Game[]> GamesByDateAsync(AreGamesInProgressFormat format, string date, Action<System.Net.Http.Headers.HttpRequestHeaders> handleHeaders = null)
		{
			var requestUri = ""+format+"/GamesByDate/"+ (date==null? "" : System.Uri.EscapeDataString(date));
			using (var httpRequestMessage = new System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage(System.Net.Http.HttpMethod.Get, requestUri))
			{
			if (handleHeaders != null)
			{
				handleHeaders(httpRequestMessage.Headers);
			}

			var responseMessage = await httpClient.SendAsync(httpRequestMessage);
			try
			{
				responseMessage.EnsureSuccessStatusCodeEx();
				var responseMessageStream = await responseMessage.Content.ReadAsStreamAsync();
				using (JsonReader jsonReader = new JsonTextReader(new System.IO.StreamReader(responseMessageStream)))
				{
				var serializer = JsonSerializer.Create(jsonSerializerSettings);
				return serializer.Deserialize<Game[]>(jsonReader);
				}
			}
			finally
			{
				responseMessage.Dispose();
			}
			}
		}
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Games by Week
		/// GamesByWeek {format}/GamesByWeek/{season}/{week}
		/// </summary>
		/// <param name="format">Desired response format. Valid entries are <code>xml</code> or <code>json</code>.</param>
		/// <param name="season">
		///          Year of the season.
		///          <br>Examples: <code>2015</code>, <code>2016</code>, etc.
		///        </param>
		/// <param name="week">
		///          The week of the game(s).
		///          <br>Examples: <code>1</code>, <code>2</code>, <code>3</code>, etc.
		///        </param>
		public async Task<Game[]> GamesByWeekAsync(AreGamesInProgressFormat format, string season, string week, Action<System.Net.Http.Headers.HttpRequestHeaders> handleHeaders = null)
		{
			var requestUri = ""+format+"/GamesByWeek/"+ (season==null? "" : System.Uri.EscapeDataString(season))+"/"+ (week==null? "" : System.Uri.EscapeDataString(week));
			using (var httpRequestMessage = new System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage(System.Net.Http.HttpMethod.Get, requestUri))
			{
			if (handleHeaders != null)
			{
				handleHeaders(httpRequestMessage.Headers);
			}

			var responseMessage = await httpClient.SendAsync(httpRequestMessage);
			try
			{
				responseMessage.EnsureSuccessStatusCodeEx();
				var responseMessageStream = await responseMessage.Content.ReadAsStreamAsync();
				using (JsonReader jsonReader = new JsonTextReader(new System.IO.StreamReader(responseMessageStream)))
				{
				var serializer = JsonSerializer.Create(jsonSerializerSettings);
				return serializer.Deserialize<Game[]>(jsonReader);
				}
			}
			finally
			{
				responseMessage.Dispose();
			}
			}
		}
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Injured Players
		/// This endpoint provides all currently injured college football players, along with injury details.
		/// InjuredPlayers {format}/InjuredPlayers
		/// </summary>
		/// <param name="format">Desired response format. Valid entries are <code>xml</code> or <code>json</code>.</param>
		public async Task<Player[]> InjuredPlayersAsync(AreGamesInProgressFormat format, Action<System.Net.Http.Headers.HttpRequestHeaders> handleHeaders = null)
		{
			var requestUri = ""+format+"/InjuredPlayers";
			using (var httpRequestMessage = new System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage(System.Net.Http.HttpMethod.Get, requestUri))
			{
			if (handleHeaders != null)
			{
				handleHeaders(httpRequestMessage.Headers);
			}

			var responseMessage = await httpClient.SendAsync(httpRequestMessage);
			try
			{
				responseMessage.EnsureSuccessStatusCodeEx();
				var responseMessageStream = await responseMessage.Content.ReadAsStreamAsync();
				using (JsonReader jsonReader = new JsonTextReader(new System.IO.StreamReader(responseMessageStream)))
				{
				var serializer = JsonSerializer.Create(jsonSerializerSettings);
				return serializer.Deserialize<Player[]>(jsonReader);
				}
			}
			finally
			{
				responseMessage.Dispose();
			}
			}
		}
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Conference Hierarchy (with Teams)
		/// ConferenceHierarchyWithTeams {format}/LeagueHierarchy
		/// </summary>
		/// <param name="format">Desired response format. Valid entries are <code>xml</code> or <code>json</code>.</param>
		public async Task<Conference[]> ConferenceHierarchyWithTeamsAsync(AreGamesInProgressFormat format, Action<System.Net.Http.Headers.HttpRequestHeaders> handleHeaders = null)
		{

			}
			}
		}
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Player Details By Player
		/// PlayerDetailsByPlayer {format}/Player/{playerid}
		/// </summary>
		/// <param name="format">Desired response format. Valid entries are <code>XML</code> or <code>JSON</code>.</param>
		/// <param name="playerid">
		///          Unique FantasyData Player ID.
		///          Example:<code>50002016</code>.
		///        </param>
		public async Task<Player[]> PlayerDetailsByPlayerAsync(AreGamesInProgressFormat format, string playerid, Action<System.Net.Http.Headers.HttpRequestHeaders> handleHeaders = null)
		{
			var requestUri = ""+format+"/Player/"+ (playerid==null? "" : System.Uri.EscapeDataString(playerid));
			using (var httpRequestMessage = new System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage(System.Net.Http.HttpMethod.Get, requestUri))
			{
			if (handleHeaders != null)
			{
				handleHeaders(httpRequestMessage.Headers);
			}

			var responseMessage = await httpClient.SendAsync(httpRequestMessage);
			try
			{
				responseMessage.EnsureSuccessStatusCodeEx();
				var responseMessageStream = await responseMessage.Content.ReadAsStreamAsync();
				using (JsonReader jsonReader = new JsonTextReader(new System.IO.StreamReader(responseMessageStream)))
				{
				var serializer = JsonSerializer.Create(jsonSerializerSettings);
				return serializer.Deserialize<Player[]>(jsonReader);
				}
			}
			finally
			{
				responseMessage.Dispose();
			}
			}
		}
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Player Details By Active
		/// PlayerDetailsByActive {format}/Players
		/// </summary>
		/// <param name="format">Desired response format. Valid entries are <code>XML</code> or <code>JSON</code>.</param>
		public async Task<Player[]> PlayerDetailsByActiveAsync(AreGamesInProgressFormat format, Action<System.Net.Http.Headers.HttpRequestHeaders> handleHeaders = null)
		{

		/// <summary>
		/// Player Details by Team
		/// PlayerDetailsByTeam {format}/Players/{team}
		/// </summary>
		/// <param name="format">Desired response format. Valid entries are <code>XML</code> or <code>JSON</code>.</param>
		/// <param name="team">
		///          The abbreviation of the requested team.
		///          <br>Examples: <code>SF</code>, <code>NYY</code>.
		///        </param>
		public async Task<Player[]> PlayerDetailsByTeamAsync(AreGamesInProgressFormat format, string team, Action<System.Net.Http.Headers.HttpRequestHeaders> handleHeaders = null)
		{
			var requestUri = ""+format+"/Players/"+ (team==null? "" : System.Uri.EscapeDataString(team));
			using (var httpRequestMessage = new System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage(System.Net.Http.HttpMethod.Get, requestUri))
			{
			if (handleHeaders != null)
			{
				handleHeaders(httpRequestMessage.Headers);
			}

			var responseMessage = await httpClient.SendAsync(httpRequestMessage);
			try
			{
				responseMessage.EnsureSuccessStatusCodeEx();
				var responseMessageStream = await responseMessage.Content.ReadAsStreamAsync();
				using (JsonReader jsonReader = new JsonTextReader(new System.IO.StreamReader(responseMessageStream)))
				{
				var serializer = JsonSerializer.Create(jsonSerializerSettings);
				return serializer.Deserialize<Player[]>(jsonReader);
				}
			}
			finally
			{
				responseMessage.Dispose();
			}
			}
		}
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Players by Team (Basic)
		/// PlayersByTeamBasic {format}/PlayersBasic/{team}
		/// </summary>
		/// <param name="format">Desired response format. Valid entries are <code>XML</code> or <code>JSON</code>.</param>
		/// <param name="team">
		///          The abbreviation of the requested team.
		///          <br>Examples: <code>SF</code>, <code>NYY</code>.
		///        </param>
		public async Task<PlayerBasic[]> PlayersByTeamBasicAsync(AreGamesInProgressFormat format, string team, Action<System.Net.Http.Headers.HttpRequestHeaders> handleHeaders = null)
		{

			{
				handleHeaders(httpRequestMessage.Headers);
			}

			try

				{

				}
			}
			finally

				responseMessage.Dispose();
			}
			}
		}
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Schedules (Basic)
		/// SchedulesBasic {format}/SchedulesBasic/{season}
		/// </summary>
		/// <param name="format">Desired response format. Valid entries are <code>xml</code> or <code>json</code>.</param>
		/// <param name="season">Year of the season (with optional season type).<br>Examples: <code>2018</code>, <code>2018PRE</code>, <code>2018POST</code>, <code>2018STAR</code>, <code>2019</code>, etc.</param>
		public async Task<ScheduleBasic[]> SchedulesBasicAsync(AreGamesInProgressFormat format, string season, Action<System.Net.Http.Headers.HttpRequestHeaders> handleHeaders = null)
		{
			var requestUri = ""+format+"/SchedulesBasic/"+ (season==null? "" : System.Uri.EscapeDataString(season));
			using (var httpRequestMessage = new System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage(System.Net.Http.HttpMethod.Get, requestUri))
			{
			if (handleHeaders != null)
			{
				handleHeaders(httpRequestMessage.Headers);
			}

			var responseMessage = await httpClient.SendAsync(httpRequestMessage);
			try
			{
				responseMessage.EnsureSuccessStatusCodeEx();
				var responseMessageStream = await responseMessage.Content.ReadAsStreamAsync();
				using (JsonReader jsonReader = new JsonTextReader(new System.IO.StreamReader(responseMessageStream)))
				{
				var serializer = JsonSerializer.Create(jsonSerializerSettings);
				return serializer.Deserialize<ScheduleBasic[]>(jsonReader);
				}
			}
			finally
			{
				responseMessage.Dispose();
			}
			}
		}
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Games by Week (Basic)
		/// GamesByWeekBasic {format}/ScoresBasic/{season}/{week}
		/// </summary>
		/// <param name="format">Desired response format. Valid entries are <code>xml</code> or <code>json</code>.</param>
		/// <param name="season">
		///          Year of the season.
		///          <br>Examples: <code>2015</code>, <code>2016</code>, etc.
		///        </param>
		/// <param name="week">
		///          The week of the game(s).
		///          <br>Examples: <code>1</code>, <code>2</code>, <code>3</code>, etc.
		///        </param>
		public async Task<object> GamesByWeekBasicAsync(AreGamesInProgressFormat format, string season, string week, Action<System.Net.Http.Headers.HttpRequestHeaders> handleHeaders = null)
		{
			var requestUri = ""+format+"/ScoresBasic/"+ (season==null? "" : System.Uri.EscapeDataString(season))+"/"+ (week==null? "" : System.Uri.EscapeDataString(week));
			using (var httpRequestMessage = new System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage(System.Net.Http.HttpMethod.Get, requestUri))
			{
			if (handleHeaders != null)
			{
				handleHeaders(httpRequestMessage.Headers);
			}

			var responseMessage = await httpClient.SendAsync(httpRequestMessage);
			try
			{
				responseMessage.EnsureSuccessStatusCodeEx();
				var responseMessageStream = await responseMessage.Content.ReadAsStreamAsync();
				using (JsonReader jsonReader = new JsonTextReader(new System.IO.StreamReader(responseMessageStream)))
				{
				var serializer = JsonSerializer.Create(jsonSerializerSettings);
				return serializer.Deserialize<object>(jsonReader);
				}
			}
			finally
			{
				responseMessage.Dispose();
			}
			}
		}
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Stadiums
		/// Stadiums {format}/Stadiums
		/// </summary>
		/// <param name="format">Desired response format. Valid entries are <code>xml</code> or <code>json</code>.</param>
		public async Task<Stadium[]> StadiumsAsync(AreGamesInProgressFormat format, Action<System.Net.Http.Headers.HttpRequestHeaders> handleHeaders = null)
		{
			var requestUri = ""+format+"/Stadiums";
			using (var httpRequestMessage = new System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage(System.Net.Http.HttpMethod.Get, requestUri))
			{
			if (handleHeaders != null)
			{
				handleHeaders(httpRequestMessage.Headers);
			}

			var responseMessage = await httpClient.SendAsync(httpRequestMessage);
			try
			{
				responseMessage.EnsureSuccessStatusCodeEx();

				using (JsonReader jsonReader = new JsonTextReader(new System.IO.StreamReader(responseMessageStream)))
				{
				var serializer = JsonSerializer.Create(jsonSerializerSettings);
				return serializer.Deserialize<Stadium[]>(jsonReader);
				}
			}
			finally
			{
				responseMessage.Dispose();
			}
			}
		}
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Team Game Logs By Season
		/// Game by game log of total team statistics.
		/// TeamGameLogsBySeason {format}/TeamGameStatsBySeason/{season}/{teamid}/{numberofgames}
		/// </summary>
		/// <param name="format">Desired response format. Valid entries are <code>xml</code> or <code>json</code>.</param>
		/// <param name="season">Season to get games from. Example <code>2019POST</code>, <code>2020</code>        </param>
		/// <param name="teamid">Unique ID of team.  Example <code> 1 </code></param>
		/// <param name="numberofgames">How many games to return. Example <code>all</code>, <code>10</code>, <code>25</code></param>
		public async Task<TeamGame[]> TeamGameLogsBySeasonAsync(AreGamesInProgressFormat format, string season, string teamid, string numberofgames, Action<System.Net.Http.Headers.HttpRequestHeaders> handleHeaders = null)
		{
			var requestUri = ""+format+"/TeamGameStatsBySeason/"+ (season==null? "" : System.Uri.EscapeDataString(season))+"/"+ (teamid==null? "" : System.Uri.EscapeDataString(teamid))+"/"+ (numberofgames==null? "" : System.Uri.EscapeDataString(numberofgames));
			using (var httpRequestMessage = new System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage(System.Net.Http.HttpMethod.Get, requestUri))
			{
			if (handleHeaders != null)
			{
				handleHeaders(httpRequestMessage.Headers);
			}

			var responseMessage = await httpClient.SendAsync(httpRequestMessage);
			try
			{
				responseMessage.EnsureSuccessStatusCodeEx();
				var responseMessageStream = await responseMessage.Content.ReadAsStreamAsync();
				using (JsonReader jsonReader = new JsonTextReader(new System.IO.StreamReader(responseMessageStream)))
				{
				var serializer = JsonSerializer.Create(jsonSerializerSettings);
				return serializer.Deserialize<TeamGame[]>(jsonReader);
				}
			}
			finally
			{
				responseMessage.Dispose();
			}
			}
		}
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Team Game Stats by Week
		/// TeamGameStatsByWeek {format}/TeamGameStatsByWeek/{season}/{week}
		/// </summary>
		/// <param name="format">Desired response format. Valid entries are <code>xml</code> or <code>json</code>.</param>
		/// <param name="season">
		///          Year of the season.
		///          <br>Examples: <code>2015</code>, <code>2016</code>, etc.
		///        </param>
		/// <param name="week">
		///          The week of the game(s).
		///          <br>Examples: <code>1</code>, <code>2</code>, <code>3</code>, etc.
		///        </param>
		public async Task<TeamGame[]> TeamGameStatsByWeekAsync(AreGamesInProgressFormat format, string season, string week, Action<System.Net.Http.Headers.HttpRequestHeaders> handleHeaders = null)
		{
			var requestUri = ""+format+"/TeamGameStatsByWeek/"+ (season==null? "" : System.Uri.EscapeDataString(season))+"/"+ (week==null? "" : System.Uri.EscapeDataString(week));
			using (var httpRequestMessage = new System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage(System.Net.Http.HttpMethod.Get, requestUri))
			{
			if (handleHeaders != null)
			{
				handleHeaders(httpRequestMessage.Headers);
			}

			var responseMessage = await httpClient.SendAsync(httpRequestMessage);
			try
			{
				responseMessage.EnsureSuccessStatusCodeEx();
				var responseMessageStream = await responseMessage.Content.ReadAsStreamAsync();
				using (JsonReader jsonReader = new JsonTextReader(new System.IO.StreamReader(responseMessageStream)))
				{
				var serializer = JsonSerializer.Create(jsonSerializerSettings);
				return serializer.Deserialize<TeamGame[]>(jsonReader);
				}
			}
			finally
			{
				responseMessage.Dispose();
			}
			}
		}
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Team Season Stats & Standings
		/// TeamSeasonStatsStandings {format}/TeamSeasonStats/{season}
		/// </summary>
		/// <param name="format">Desired response format. Valid entries are <code>xml</code> or <code>json</code>.</param>
		/// <param name="season">Year of the season (with optional season type).<br>Examples: <code>2017</code>, <code>2017POST</code>, <code>2018</code>.</param>
		public async Task<TeamSeason[]> TeamSeasonStatsStandingsAsync(AreGamesInProgressFormat format, string season, Action<System.Net.Http.Headers.HttpRequestHeaders> handleHeaders = null)
		{
			var requestUri = ""+format+"/TeamSeasonStats/"+ (season==null? "" : System.Uri.EscapeDataString(season));
			using (var httpRequestMessage = new System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage(System.Net.Http.HttpMethod.Get, requestUri))
			{
			if (handleHeaders != null)
			{
				handleHeaders(httpRequestMessage.Headers);
			}

			var responseMessage = await httpClient.SendAsync(httpRequestMessage);
			try
			{
				responseMessage.EnsureSuccessStatusCodeEx();
				var responseMessageStream = await responseMessage.Content.ReadAsStreamAsync();
				using (JsonReader jsonReader = new JsonTextReader(new System.IO.StreamReader(responseMessageStream)))
				{
				var serializer = JsonSerializer.Create(jsonSerializerSettings);
				return serializer.Deserialize<TeamSeason[]>(jsonReader);
				}
			}
			finally
			{
				responseMessage.Dispose();
			}
			}
		}
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Teams
		/// Teams {format}/Teams
		/// </summary>
		/// <param name="format">Desired response format. Valid entries are <code>xml</code> or <code>json</code>.</param>
		public async Task<Team[]> TeamsAsync(AreGamesInProgressFormat format, Action<System.Net.Http.Headers.HttpRequestHeaders> handleHeaders = null)
		{
			var requestUri = ""+format+"/Teams";
			using (var httpRequestMessage = new System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage(System.Net.Http.HttpMethod.Get, requestUri))
			{
			if (handleHeaders != null)
			{
				handleHeaders(httpRequestMessage.Headers);
			}

			var responseMessage = await httpClient.SendAsync(httpRequestMessage);
			try
			{
				responseMessage.EnsureSuccessStatusCodeEx();
				var responseMessageStream = await responseMessage.Content.ReadAsStreamAsync();
				using (JsonReader jsonReader = new JsonTextReader(new System.IO.StreamReader(responseMessageStream)))
				{
				var serializer = JsonSerializer.Create(jsonSerializerSettings);
				return serializer.Deserialize<Team[]>(jsonReader);
				}
			}
			finally
			{
				responseMessage.Dispose();
			}
			}
		}
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Teams (Basic)
		/// TeamsBasic {format}/TeamsBasic
		/// </summary>
		/// <param name="format">Desired response format. Valid entries are <code>xml</code> or <code>json</code>.</param>
		public async Task<TeamBasic[]> TeamsBasicAsync(AreGamesInProgressFormat format, Action<System.Net.Http.Headers.HttpRequestHeaders> handleHeaders = null)
		{
			var requestUri = ""+format+"/TeamsBasic";
			using (var httpRequestMessage = new System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage(System.Net.Http.HttpMethod.Get, requestUri))
			{
			if (handleHeaders != null)
			{
				handleHeaders(httpRequestMessage.Headers);
			}

			var responseMessage = await httpClient.SendAsync(httpRequestMessage);
			try
			{
				responseMessage.EnsureSuccessStatusCodeEx();
				var responseMessageStream = await responseMessage.Content.ReadAsStreamAsync();
				using (JsonReader jsonReader = new JsonTextReader(new System.IO.StreamReader(responseMessageStream)))
				{
				var serializer = JsonSerializer.Create(jsonSerializerSettings);
				return serializer.Deserialize<TeamBasic[]>(jsonReader);
				}
			}
			finally
			{
				responseMessage.Dispose();
			}
			}
		}
	}
	
	public enum AreGamesInProgressFormat
	{
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.EnumMemberAttribute(Value="XML")]
		XML = 0,
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.EnumMemberAttribute(Value="JSON")]
		JSON = 1,
	}
}

namespace Fonlow.Net.Http
{
	using System.Net.Http;

	public class WebApiRequestException : HttpRequestException
	{
		public System.Net.HttpStatusCode StatusCode { get; private set; }

		public string Response { get; private set; }

		public System.Net.Http.Headers.HttpResponseHeaders Headers { get; private set; }

		public System.Net.Http.Headers.MediaTypeHeaderValue ContentType { get; private set; }

		public WebApiRequestException(string message, System.Net.HttpStatusCode statusCode, string response, System.Net.Http.Headers.HttpResponseHeaders headers, System.Net.Http.Headers.MediaTypeHeaderValue contentType) : base(message)
		{
			StatusCode = statusCode;
			Response = response;
			Headers = headers;
			ContentType = contentType;
		}
	}

	public static class ResponseMessageExtensions
	{
		public static void EnsureSuccessStatusCodeEx(this HttpResponseMessage responseMessage)
		{
			if (!responseMessage.IsSuccessStatusCode)
			{
				var responseText = responseMessage.Content.ReadAsStringAsync().Result;
				var contentType = responseMessage.Content.Headers.ContentType;
				throw new WebApiRequestException(responseMessage.ReasonPhrase, responseMessage.StatusCode, responseText, responseMessage.Headers, contentType);
			}
		}
	}
}
